Gibbs sampler for a Bradley–Terry Stochastic Block Model

Source: R/mcmc_bt_sbm.R
gibbs_bt_sbm.Rd

Runs a Gibbs sampler for a BT–SBM with a Gamma(a, b) prior on block rates and a choice of clustering prior (DP, Pitman–Yor, Dirichlet–Multinomial, or Gnedin).

Usage

gibbs_bt_sbm(
  w_ij,
  n_ij,
  a,
  b,
  prior = "DP",
  alpha_PY = NA,
  sigma_PY = NA,
  beta_DM = NA,
  H_DM = NA,
  gamma_GN = NA,
  n_iter = 2000,
  burnin = 1000,
  init_x = NULL,
  store_z = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

w_ij

integer/numeric K x K matrix of wins from i over j (diagonal ignored).

n_ij

integer/numeric K x K matrix of total matches between i and j (symmetric, diag 0).

a

numeric(1). Shape for the Gamma(a, b) prior on each block rate at init; updated inside.

b

numeric(1). Rate for the Gamma(a, b) prior (fixed).

prior

character(1). One of c("DP","PY","DM","GN").

alpha_PY

numeric(1) or NA. Concentration for DP/PY (must be > 0 when used).

sigma_PY

numeric(1) or NA. Discount for PY in [0,1); set 0 for DP if using "PY".

beta_DM

numeric(1) or NA. Dirichlet-Multinomial concentration (>0) if prior="DM".

H_DM

integer(1) or NA. Max # clusters for DM (>=1) if prior="DM".

gamma_GN

numeric(1) or NA. Parameter for Gnedin if prior="GN".

n_iter

integer(1). Total MCMC iterations.

burnin

integer(1). Number of initial iterations to discard (must be < n_iter).

init_x

integer vector of length K with initial cluster labels (1..K), or NULL.

store_z

logical(1). If TRUE, store the latent Z matrices.

verbose

logical(1). If TRUE, print progress every 200 iters.

a_prior_draw

function with signature function() numeric(1). Draws a proposal from the prior of \(a\) (Damien slice sampler). Default is function() rexp(1, 1) (Exp(1) on \(a>0\)).

a_prior_support

function with signature function(a) logical(1). Checks support of \(a\). Default: function(a) a > 0.

Value

A list with:

x_samples

(n_save x K) integer matrix of cluster labels after burn-in.

lambda_samples

(n_save x K) numeric matrix of block rates (entries for empty labels can be unused).

z_samples

optional (n_save x K x K) array of latent \(Z_{ij}\) if store_z=TRUE.

Details

  • The sampler uses Gamma-Poisson augmentation for the BT likelihood: \(Z_{ij} \sim \mathrm{Gamma}(n_{ij}, \lambda_{x_i}+\lambda_{x_j})\).

  • Cluster reassignment uses a one-step CRP/PY/DM/GN urn with a marginal new-cluster integral under \(\lambda \sim \mathrm{Gamma}(a,b)\).

  • \(a\) is updated via a Damien-style slice move on the joint of \(\lambda\) given \(b\) and the prior on \(a\).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(1)
K <- 6
w <- matrix(0, K, K); n <- matrix(0, K, K)
n[upper.tri(n)] <- sample(0:5, sum(upper.tri(n)), TRUE)
n <- n + t(n); diag(n) <- 0
w[upper.tri(w)] <- rbinom(sum(upper.tri(w)), size = n[upper.tri(n)], prob = 0.5)
w <- w + t(n - w); diag(w) <- 0
out <- gibbs_bt_sbm(w, n, a = 1, b = 1, prior = "DP", alpha_PY = 1,
                    n_iter = 500, burnin = 250, verbose = FALSE)
str(out)
} # }
